activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hosea V Cobb

records.addlTxt:
8:51 AM Defendant Hosea V Cobb in court.  Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant indicates he has not gone to the Public Defender's office. 
State puts the offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Hosea V Cobb
Current: 1125 College Ave, Apt #203, Racine, WI 53403   (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: 1522 Packard Ave, Racine, WI 53403
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report
State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim L.C (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Hosea V Cobb appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson appeared by video for Hosea V Cobb. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
